brief_description: The primary goal for RA arthroplasty P1 studies are:  To establish if molecular signatures and pathways identified using core AMP technologies differ between OA and RA in 20 RA surgical samples and 10 OA arthroplasty samples.
description: The primary goal for RA arthroplasty P1 studies are:  To establish if molecular signatures and pathways identified using core AMP technologies differ between OA and RA in 20 RA surgical samples and 10 OA arthroplasty samples.
endpoints:
Clinical data, Histology, Flow cytometry, Mass cytometry Blood (PBMC and TL prep)
Mass cytometry synovium, Low input RNA Seq Synovium, Single Cell RNA Seq Synovium (plate based cell seq 2)
hypothesis: To ensure practical factors can be mastered prior to Phase II:   Tissue, Technology Validation and Clinical Site Qualification: A) 20 RA surgical tissue and 10 OA tissue will be processed for further validation of the tissue validation studies, work flow and for the technology core if needed for tech site validation. These, and potentially additional samples can be (acquired) and used for the study of nested technologies.
